item.title: How to Shop at Boutique Couture in Pokemon Legends: Z-A (Truly Stylish)
item.description:
Lumiose City is home to dozens of cafes and shops in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , but one exclusive clothing store won't let anyone in unless they're "truly stylish." You can shop at Boutique Couture in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , but there are a few things you have to do before they'll sell you anything.

You can find Boutique Coutere very early in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , and it seems like any other clothing store at first glance. It's even located near the first few Wild Zones you get access to, so it's a bit odd that such an elite establishment is found in the starting area of Lumiose City. You'll have to work your way up the ranks of the Z-A Royale before you can purchase any of their fancy clothes.

How to Buy Clothes at Boutique Coutere in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Boutique Coutere is located at the Promenade du Vent shopping center on the southern side of Lumiose City in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . It's just north of Wild Zone 1 , halfway up the street leading to the Prism Tower in the center of the map.

You'll be able to see some fancy clothing items on display in the shop's window, including an expensive coat and some cool shoes, but you can't shop there just yet. The employee at the door states that Boutique Couture is for none but the "truly stylish."

To shop at Boutique Coutere in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , all you have to do is get far enough in the main story. You'll visit the Boutique Coutere store as part of Main Mission 26 , after which, you'll be free to return and shop whenever you want. There's no way to shop at Boutique Couture before then.

Thankfully, there are plenty of other clothing stores in Pokemon Legends: Z-A that you can shop at in the meantime. The clothes at Boutique Coutere are quite expensive, so it's a good idea to complete side quests and other activities throughout Lumiose City to earn some spending cash.

66
5.1 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth Director Makes Big Promise About Switch 2 Version
item.description:
Nintendo fans have no reason to be concerned about the Switch 2 version of Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , a senior Square Enix official said. The company aims to deliver a port at least on par with the Switch 2 version of its first remake, and noted that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth may even surpass its predecessor in terms of handheld optimization.

The Switch 2 version of Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade has recently locked down a concrete release date: January 22, 2026. Separately, Square Enix said the rest of the remake trilogy will also make its way to Nintendo's hybrid console eventually, albeit without sharing any specifics.

FF7 Rebirth May Surpass FF7 Remake in Switch 2 Performance

While Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth has been praised as one of the most graphically impressive games of 2024, it should still translate well to the Switch 2's hardware, which is modest compared to the current-gen consoles from PlayStation and Xbox. That's according to longtime Final Fantasy producer Naoki Hamaguchi, who told VGC that Square Enix is "working very hard" to ensure the game runs as well as possible on the hybrid console. "[Switch 2 owners] are going to get a version that is just as satisfying and just as high quality as the first game, if not higher," the executive said.

FF7 Remake Intergrade Switch 2 Port Is Already Looking Promising

While it has yet to reach Nintendo's hybrid console, the new port of the first entry in the remake trilogy is already looking promising. Square Enix recently shared a video comparing the visuals of the Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade Switch 2 version to other platforms, which indicated that the game will at the very least offer a similar level of graphical fidelity during cutscenes. On the performance front, the developer committed to targeting 30 frames per second.

Even if the Switch 2 version of Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth targets similar performance levels as its predecessor, it could still fulfill Hamaguchi’s promise of improvement—for instance, by offering a more stable frame rate. While the likelihood of Square Enix aiming for more than 30fps on the Switch 2 is rather low, it cannot be ruled out entirely. The performance of FF7 Remake Intergrade on the console will likely serve as the clearest indicator of what to expect from Rebirth , given that both titles use the same engine, share many assets, and are developed by the same studio.

[Switch 2 owners] are going to get a version that is just as satisfying and just as high quality as the first game, if not higher.

Square Enix has yet to specify when the second entry in the trilogy will arrive on Nintendo’s latest console. Since the physical Switch 2 version of Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade will be a Game-Key Card release, its sequel is likely to follow suit.

50
9.3 /10

item.title: How to Redeploy Teammates in Battlefield RedSec
item.description:
Battlefield RedSec has arrived and is already proving to be a strong contender in the free-to-play Battle Royale space, taking players on a wild ride. Those dropping in can expect classic Battle Royale gameplay mixed with the signature Battlefield experience, complete with tanks, helicopters, and large-scale destruction.

Battlefield RedSec is highly competitive, with every player fighting to be the last one standing. Naturally, players will find themselves getting eliminated early on or losing a squadmate mid-match. In moments like these, knowing how to bring your teammates back into the fight is key. For those unsure how to do it, here’s how to redeploy teammates in Battlefield RedSec .

How Do Redeploys Work in Battlefield RedSec?

Battlefield RedSec borrows several elements from past Battle Royale titles, allowing players to bring back their downed squadmates. However, it features one major twist. At the start of every match, all players are given a free redeploy , a built-in second chance that automatically activates after elimination following a short timer.

Once the timer runs out, players will redeploy into an area near where they were previously eliminated, giving everyone one free respawn early on. This second chance does not last the entire match, though, as the feature becomes unavailable later in the game. After this point, or once a player has already used their free redeploy, teammates can only be brought back by using a Redeploy Tower.

How to Redeploy Teammates in Battlefield RedSec

As mentioned earlier, players who no longer have a second chance available will need to be redeployed using a Redeploy Tower. These towers can be found in every major named POI across the Battlefield RedSec map, with their locations marked both on the map and on the HUD once a squad member has been eliminated. These can also be pinged by both yourself and squadmates using the map to better pinpoint their locations.

When you locate a Redeploy Tower, interact with it to begin the redeployment process. Players must stay within the area as the tower activates, with the activation status displayed on screen. During this time, the tower emits a loud siren-like sound that can alert nearby enemies to your position, so be prepared for possible engagements.

Once the Redeploy Tower has fully activated, all currently eliminated squadmates will redeploy into the area, and the tower will become inactive afterward.

Battlefield REDSEC
8.0 /10
Released
October 28, 2025

item.title: Outer Worlds 2: Best Skills
item.description:
There are twelve Skills Outer Worlds 2 players can choose from in character creation, including Engineering, Explosives, Guns, Hack, Leadership, Lockpick, Melee, Medical, Observation, Science, Sneak, and Speech. Each Skill has specific benefits and RP potential, but some Skills are more broadly useful than others.

For example, the Lockpick skill grants access to an enormous number of locked areas and secret locked caches, while Speech can help any build in Outer Worlds 2 successfully get what they want out of RP dialogue checks.

This guide lists the six best Skills Outer Worlds 2 players should consider picking up, alongside a list of Perks associated with each of the best Skills listed below.

Lockpick

The Lockpick skill allows you to unlock locked containers and doors.

  • Base Skill Bonus : Locks with a difficulty at or below your skill level can be opened with a Mag-Pick.
  • Bonus Per Level : +1% Evasion Chance

All Perks Unlocked With Lockpick Skill in Outer Worlds 2

Investing in the Lockpick skill allows you to select perks that grant the ability to pickpocket humans and preview the contents of locked containers.

Perk Name

Perk Description

Perk Requirements

Pickpocket

Gain the ability to pickpocket others. Pickpocketing can be activated by crouching up to an unaware human and having enough Lockpick skill.

Lockpick 1

Through the Keyhole

The contents of a locked container can be viewed before lockpicking. Also, you gain an increased range bonus with guns.

Lockpick 2

Bag Check

While crouching, you can see the contents of a person's inventory before pickpocketing them. You also gain a small bonus to Critical Chance.

Lockpick 4, Perk: Pickpocket

Sleight of Hands

Pickpocketing is significantly faster and you gain a bonus to sneak attack damage based on your Lockpick skill.

Lockpick 8, Perk: Pickpocket

Speech

The Speech skill allows you to better influence others in conversations.

  • Base Skill Bonus : Speech checks with a difficulty at or below your skill level can be selected.
  • Bonus Per Level : +5% Damage to Humans

All Perks Unlocked With Speech Skill in Outer Worlds 2

Investing in the Speech skill allows you to select perks that let you get discounts at vendors, intimidate others, and gain more reputation with factions.

Perk Name

Perk Description

Perk Requirements

Space Ranger

Your Speech skill also scales damage.

Speech 1

Palm-Greaser

Bribes now cost less and stolen items sell for more.

Speech 2

Wholesale Spender

Buying or selling items with a vendor accrues goodwill. After accruing enough, you gain a permanent discount and sell bonus with that vendor.

Speech 4

Intimidator

Dealing damage to Weak humans or creatures Frightens them a short duration. Has a cooldown between activations, which shortens with your Speech skill. Strong enemies cannot be Frightened until their health has been significantly reduced.

Speech 5

Charlatan

Many of your lies are more believable and will more likely be accepted as true. Additionally, the likelihood that enemies will target you is reduced.

Speech 6, must purchase 4 other Perks

Grim Visage

Scoring a kill will temporarily cause human and creature enemies near the target to be Frightened for a short duration. Strong enemies cannot be Frightened until their health has been significantly reduced.

Speech 9, must purchase 6 other Perks, including Perk: Intimidator

Tall Tale Teller

Only your most outlandish lies aren't believed, with you being able to lie about even more things. Additionally, you gain a bonus to damage when attacking enemies that aren't targeting you directly.

Speech 10, must purchase 7 other Perks, including Perk: Charlatan

Guns

The Guns skill increases damage dealt with all types of guns, including ballistic, shock, plasma, and bio guns.

  • Base Skill Bonus : N / A
  • Bonus Per Level : +10% Ranged Damage, +1% Armor Penetration

All Perks Unlocked With Guns Skill in Outer Worlds 2

Investing in the Guns skill allows you to select perks that further improve your ability to use guns of various types.

Perk Name

Perk Description

Perk Requirements

Point Blank Artist

Damage with shotguns, SMGs, and pistols is increased against targets within 10m, but less above that distance. Those weapons also gain increased sneak attack damage.

Guns 1

Crabble Rancher

Marksman rifles, pistols, and shotguns deal increased damage. While the magazine of one of these weapons is half empty, also gain a bonus to critical hit chance.

Guns 2

Serendipitous Slayer

You gain an innate critical hit chance with pistols and SMGs. Additionally, critical hits with these weapons automatically reload a small portion of the weapon's magazine.

Guns 2

Deep Drums

Machine Guns, Special weapons, and Assault Rifles slowly reload automatically. Additionally, all weapons have an increased magazine size.

Guns 3

Eden Windage

Marksman rifles, pistols, and sniper rifles have increased range and weakspot damage.

Guns 3, Perk: Crabble Rancher

Gun Runner

You can now fire while sliding, mantling, and sprinting with assault rifles, shotguns, and SMGs. Additionally, the spread for these weapon types is reduced.

Guns 4

Hail of Lead

Guns with automatic or burst fire deal increasing damage the more you fire. This bonus resets after swapping weapons or not firing for a few seconds and has a cap of +100%.

Guns 5

Penetrating Shots

Your shotguns and SMGs ignore a portion of armor, making them more effective against armored enemies.

Guns 6, must purchase 8 other Perks, including Perk: Point Blank Artist

Multitasker

Your holstered weapons reload automatically when you manually reload your active weapon.

Guns 14, must purchase 7 other Perks, including Perk: Commando

Medical

The Medical skill increases maximum Toxicity, allowing more uses of the Medical Inhaler at a time and increased resistance to Zyranium poisoning.

  • Base Skill Bonus : N / A
  • Bonus Per Level : +7 Toxicity Crash Threshold and +5% Damage to Creatures

All Perks Unlocked With Medical Skill in Outer Worlds 2

Investing in the Medical skill allows you to select perks that further improve your inhaler, temporarily tame creatures, and make better use of corrosive weapons.

Perk Name

Perk Description

Perk Requirements

Caustic Researcher

You now apply Vulnerable faster when dealing Corrosive damage. Additionally, your critical hit chance against Dissolved foes is increased.

Medical 1

Connoisseur

Consumed food and drinks heal for more. Additionally, drugs add additional inhaler charge.

Medical 1

Pharm-Thusiast

You unlock an additional primer slot, allowing you to use multiple primers at once. Additionally, toxicity gained from using the inhaler is decreased. Using the inhaler applies the effects of all primers on use, but combines the total toxicity of all primers when used.

Medical 2

Survivalist

Creatures always drop raw meat, which can be eaten as food.

Medical 2

Zyranium Absorption

You accumulate zyranium poisoning much slower and can no longer receive Light and Heavy Zyranium Poisoning. Additionally, if you crash from using the inhaler, a portion of your Zyranium Poisoning is removed when the crash ends.

Medical 3

Nature's Friend

You can temporarily tame hostile creatures, having them fight by your side for a moderate duration. You can tame unaware hostile creatures by sneaking up to them and having enough medical skill. Also gain a bonus to damage against all creatures.

Medical 4

Hungry Guns

Guns that use bio-mass as ammo can hold twice as much before needing to be reloaded. Additionally, you deal more corrosive damage.

Medical 4, Perk: Caustic Researcher

Inhaler Overload

Gain the ability to take a deeper breath when using the Medical Inhaler, using an extra inhaler charge, increasing toxicity, but also granting a large amount of bonuses for a moderate duration. Activate this overload by holding down Use Inhaler while in combat.

Medical 5, Perk: Pharm-thusiast

Crash Recovery

While crashing, you continuously regenerate a small amount of health.

Medical 8

Nature's Best Friend

Tamed creatures are now permanently tamed, rewarding XP, but can't be looted.

Medical 10, must purchase 7 other Perks, including Perk: Nature's Friend

Lasting High

You can now use your medical inhaler while crashing, but at reduced efficacy. Crashes now last longer.

Medical 12, Perk: Crash Recovery

Observation

The Observation skill reveals hidden objects in the world and subtle behaviors in conversations.

  • Base Skill Bonus : Hidden Objects with a difficulty at or below your skill level can be found
  • Bonus Per Level : +15% Weakspot Damage

All Perks Unlocked With Observation Skill in Outer Worlds 2

Investing in the Observation skill allows you to select perks that let you find more loot, track enemies, and more effectively use enemy weakspots.

Perk Name

Perk Description

Perk Requirements

Treasure Hunter

Searching through containers can occasionally reward you with bonus bits or crafting materials.

Observation 1

Tracker

Hostiles on the mini-map are no longer hidden by the shroud and have their facing shown.

Observation 3

Face Reader

In conversations, options that reduce reputation with a Faction are highlighted before choosing them. Additionally, gain a bonus to damage against humans.

Observation 5

Keen Observer

You gain increased weakspot damage when crouched and not moving.

Observation 8, Perk: Trick Shot

Science!

The Science! skill increases your maximum Gadget Energy, allowing you to use gadgets like Tactical Time Dilation for longer.

  • Base Skill Bonus : N / A
  • Bonus Per Level : +7 Gadget Energy Meter Max, +10% more stacks of non-Physical Damage Type side-effects

All Perks Unlocked With Science! Skill in Outer Worlds 2

Investing in the Science skill allows you to select perks that further improve your gadgets and potency with shock weapons.

Perk Name

Perk Description

Perk Requirements

Electro-Therapist

You now apply Electrocuted faster when dealing Shock damage. Weak Automechs become Scrambled rather than Paralyzed when reaching max stacks. Does not work against Strong enemies until their health has been sufficiently reduced.

Science 1

Rapid Recharge

After dropping to 10% or less gadget energy, energy recharges faster for a few seconds.

Science 1

Slow-more

While using the Tactical Time Dilation gadget, you gain an increased evasion chance, ignoring more incoming attacks. Anytime you evade an attack, you restore a small amount of gadget energy.

Science 3

Contingency Screen

When your health hits 25%, the Gas-Energy Deflection Apparatus gadget automatically activates without spending energy. Has a cooldown between automatic activations.

Science 3, Gadget: Gas-Energy Deflection Apparatus

Weakspot Scanner

Weakspots are highlighted and damage dealt to them is increased when using the N-Ray Scanner.

Science 6, Gadget: N-Ray Scanner, must purchase 4 other Perks

Cold Blooded

You can now apply Chilled faster when dealing Frost damage, and enemies killed while Frozen will shatter, dealing frost damage to hostiles in the area.

Science 9, must purchase 6 other Perks

Targeting Scanner

Focusing on a target with the N-Ray Scanner will mark them. Marking targets prioritizes them for companions and causes the party's attacks to regenerate your energy.

Science 5, Gadget: N-Ray Scanner, must purchase 6 other Perks

Zyranium Scanner

Your energy recharges faster based on the amount of zyranium poisoning you have accumulated.

Science 5, must purchase 7 other Perks, including Perk: Zyranium Absorption

Sprayer Prayer

Auntie's Acidic Dematerializer can be charged, allowing its projectile to travel further and deal more damage.

Science 6, Gadget: Auntie's Acidic Dematerializer, must purchase 10 other Perks

N-Radiator

Once every few seconds, when you deal damage, you will deal the damage again as N-Ray.

Science 20, must purchase 12 other Perks

The Outer Worlds 2
9 /10
Released
October 29, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Mature 17+ / Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Strong Language

item.title: The Next 5 Big Graphics Games That Will Be Stunning
item.description:
Each year, game graphics grow more advanced and stunning. While we’re far from the mind-blowing tech leaps of early gaming days, new releases still wow even technically spoiled audiences with massive, detailed worlds, lifelike characters, realistic dynamic lighting, and more. Just this year, we got visually spectacular titles like Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , Assassin’s Creed Shadows , Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , Mafia: The Old Country , Ghost of Yotei , and many others that could claim the title of the best graphics of 2025.

As we approach the twilight of current-gen platforms (PS5 and Xbox Series X/S), developers are finally tapping the full power of these systems. Games that began development early in this generation are now hitting their stride. This means the coming years will bring the best-looking titles of the generation — including, of course, GTA 6 — surpassing everything we’ve seen so far. But there’s more to look forward to. Below are the biggest games with jaw-dropping graphics set to impress in early 2026.

Only games with officially confirmed release dates are listed below, though delays are always possible.

Resident Evil Requiem

Release Date: February 27, 2026

Resident Evil Requiem
Survival Horror
Action
Adventure
Shooter
Systems
Released
February 27, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Rating Pending
Powered by

Capcom has been on a roll with recent Resident Evil releases, striking a perfect balance between familiarity and innovation while exploring fresh themes and pushing the franchise into bold new territory. Technologically, Resident Evil 7: Biohazard and Resident Evil Village have both been real feasts, with the RE Engine (short for "REach," not Resident Evil ) delivering cinematic visuals that create a chillingly realistic sense of immersion in their virtual worlds.

Resident Evil Requiem is already being hailed as the most ambitious and expensive Resident Evil game yet, showcasing Capcom’s confidence in this upcoming release. Based on what we’ve seen so far, there’s little doubt that Requiem will be another thrilling chapter in this iconic franchise, and potentially one of the most visually spectacular games of 2026, with photorealistic environments and lifelike characters.

Crimson Desert

Release Date: March 19, 2026

Crimson Desert
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
March 19, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Powered by

When Crimson Desert debuted in its first trailers over four years ago, it looked simply unbelievable. As the years passed, the game grew even more ambitious, consistently blowing players’ minds with each new showcase. Sheer scale is Crimson Desert’s secret weapon, with an open world poised to be breathtakingly vast and richly detailed, offering a diverse array of activities for every taste.

From what the devs have shown so far, Crimson Desert ’s world isn’t just massive and beautiful, but also incredibly dense and interactive. Players can destroy towers and fortresses, ride dragons to unleash chaos from the skies, and dive into massive battles featuring entire armies — a rare feat, especially on such an epic scale and with such stunning technical execution. The game’s BlackSpace Engine has evolved dramatically over the years to support cutting-edge advancements, leaving just one question: how will it handle everything the team has packed in while running smoothly?

Saros

Release Date: March 20, 2026

Saros
Action
Systems
Released
March 20, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
RP - Rating Pending
Powered by

As the next major PS5 exclusive, Saros is expected to launch in a flawless technical state while building on the stellar gameplay formula established by Housemarque. A direct continuation of Returnal’s ideas, Saros promises to deepen the action-roguelike gameplay while pushing the boundaries of technology.

Returnal was among the first PS5 first-party titles, and launching nearly five years later, Saros is poised to deliver significant improvements across the board, fully harnessing the PS5’s capabilities and making creative use of the DualSense controller’s unique features. Although players might find it hard to notice every subtle visual detail amid the game’s relentless, dynamic action, driven by spectacular abilities, distinct weapons, and challenging enemies unleashing waves of bullet-hell chaos.

007 First Light

Release Date: March 27, 2026

007 First Light
Action
Adventure
Stealth
Systems
Released
March 27, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

007 First Light is described as IO Interactive’s most ambitious and expensive game ever — the perfect showcase for the latest iteration of the studio’s proprietary Glacier Next engine. As Unreal Engine 5 becomes increasingly common for triple-A development, crafting blockbuster titles with in-house technology stands out as somewhat of a flex, especially when that tech is as impressive as what powers the latest Hitman games.

From the looks of it, 007 First Light lives up to its prestige on a technical level, delivering a diverse array of expansive, incredibly detailed explorable locations, both indoors and outdoors, alongside adrenaline-fueled chases, explosive action full of destruction, believable characters, and unmistakable cinematic flair. The recent gameplay showcase raised some concerns about potential technical hiccups, but let’s not forget it was an early build, and there’s still plenty of time for the devs to polish their ambitious creation.

Grand Theft Auto 6

Release Date: May 26, 2026

Grand Theft Auto 6
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
May 26, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Rating Pending - Likely Mature 17+
Powered by

There are countless reasons to be excited about Grand Theft Auto 6 , but its technological prowess is undoubtedly near the top, captivating even those who’ve never been fans of the series. As likely one of the most expensive entertainment products ever made, GTA 6 is set to deliver unprecedented levels of realism and fidelity in a massive open world. The glimpses shown in the first trailers were so stunning that many question whether the final game can match that vision — especially with the sheer number of unique NPCs populating its world.

Rockstar, however, has given little reason for doubt, consistently overdelivering with titles that often look even more impressive at launch than in early previews. With the immense resources and talent poured into this monumental production, it’s entirely possible that GTA 6 will set a visual and technical bar so high it remains unmatched for long years, at least until next-generation platforms arrive.
